oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Newspaper, Forney's War Press
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Original newspaper, Forney's War Press, Saturday, August 15, 1863. Illustration shows "A Camp Scene-Exchanging Hard Tack for Pies." Items were found in a trunk purchased in Bucks County (Pa." Forney's was published by John Forney who served as the; secretary of the Senate in Lincoln's administration. The newspaper covered news related to the war. After the war it returned to its pre-war title The Weekly Press. Forney sold the paper in the 1870s and it ceased publication around 1880.
